result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Gingerich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel J Gingerich is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel J Gingerich was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Gingerich

records.addlTxt: for disbursement of fees

2:28 PM Defendant Daniel J Gingerich not in court.  Attorney Tia G Fisher appeared by video for Daniel J Gingerich.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states that there has been a stipulation and ordered filed into the case. Attorney Forehand gives the court some background on the defendant. Court asks about victim input. Attorney Forehand states that the victim has been in touch with her and requested counseling. Attorney Fisher speaks. Court will amend the charge to a 79.4 with a fine of 330.50 with 60 dtp.

9:24 AM Defendant Daniel J Gingerich in court.  Attorney Tia G Fisher in court for Daniel J Gingerich.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states that, after speaking with Attorney Fisher, we will be looking at trial dates. Court sets trial dates. Parties agree that they will need three days for trial. All motions need to be filed by October 26, 2022. Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Jury trial scheduled to begin November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Final status/scheduling conference on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Forehand states that the victim would like to dismiss this case. Attorney Forehand asks for a setover. Attorney Fisher asks if her client can appear by zoom. Court grants DG to appear by zoom.

2:38 PM Defendant Daniel J Gingerich not in court.  Attorney Tia G Fisher in court for Daniel J Gingerich.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fisher speaks about the treatment program that DG is in. Attorney Fisher has received an offer from the state and asks for a plea and sentencing date. Attorney Fisher asks for an amendment to the no contact. Attorney Forehand states that  the victim is agreeable to phone contact the by her. Court amends bond to allow phone contact only when the victim (Rachel) calls DG.

Defendant Daniel J Gingerich in court. Attorney Forhand asks for a setover to provide Attorney Fisher an offer within a week. Attorney Fisher waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Fisher stand mute on her clients behalf.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:37 AM Defendant Daniel J Gingrich in court. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about counsel. DG has called the public defenders office but doesn't qualify.   

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Tia Fisher. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 03/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.

DG asks for the no contact to be removed from residence. Court denies bond modification. Victim speaks about counseling. Court speaks about the victim going to passages.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
